com.mzaart.aquery

Class Constructors

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mzaart.aquery.Constructors

  • public class Constructors
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains a set of utility methods, to be imported statically, that allow the instantiation of AQuery objects in a syntactically similar way to JQuery. Note: This class isn't necessary to instantiate AQuery objects. You can still use the 'new' keyword to create AQuery objects. However, this class is obsolete when using Kotlin since objects in Kotlin are instantiated without the 'new' keyword.

    • Method Detail

      • AQ

        public static AQ AQ(AQ aquery,
                    int id)
        Instantiates an AQuery instance from a view given its Id in an AQuery object. Throws ViewNotFoundException if the view doesn't exist or the id is invalid.
        Parameters:
        aquery - The containing AQuery object.
        id - The view's id.
        Throws:
        ViewNotFoundException - If the view doesn't exist or the id is invalid.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If AQuery is null.
        See Also:
        ViewNotFoundException, IllegalArgumentException

      • AQ

        public static AQ AQ(android.content.Context context)
        Instantiates an AQuery instance from a context and sets the Context's root view as the current view.
        Parameters:
        context - Context context
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If context is null or not an Activity.
        See Also:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • AQ

        public static AQ AQ(android.content.Context context,
                    int id)
        Instantiates an AQuery instance from a view given its Id. Throws ViewNotFoundException if the view doesn't exist or the id is invalid.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context's context.
        id - The view's id.
        Throws:
        ViewNotFoundException - If the view doesn't exist or the id is invalid.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If context is null or not an Activity.
        See Also:
        ViewNotFoundException, IllegalArgumentException

      • AQ

        public static AQ AQ(android.view.View v)
        Instantiates an AQuery instance from a view.
        Parameters:
        v - The view to be used.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If view is null.
        See Also:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • AQ

        public static AQ AQ(android.view.View view,
                    int id)
        Instantiates an AQuery instance from a view given its Id in the parent view. Throws ViewNotFoundException if the view doesn't exist or the id is invalid.
        Parameters:
        view - The view's parent.
        id - The view's id.
        Throws:
        ViewNotFoundException - If the view doesn't exist or the id is invalid.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If view is null.
        See Also:
        ViewNotFoundException, IllegalArgumentException
